title: Concept-Based Interdisciplinary Language Integration and Authentic Assessment Process

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level specialized knowledge and problem-solving skills, foundational grammar comprehension, and academic writing experience
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning in limited-technology environments for job-ready language learners. Optimizes reading and writing activities in mobile settings and strengthens job-specific communication skills.

learning_goals: Perform at least three real-world language problem-solving projects using an interdisciplinary approach (including text analysis, vocabulary utilization, discourse structure evaluation).

Learners can establish monthly language learning plans using metacognitive strategies (time management, goal segmentation, self-assessment, etc.) over a six-month course, achieve over 80% of weekly execution checklists, and submit monthly self-assessment reports (including grammar accuracy and expressive diversity improvement goals).

Learners can produce a 10-page language portfolio based on information gathered from at least three academic fields (e.g., engineering, medicine, art) and achieve an "excellent" grade in at least four out of five portfolio evaluation rubric items (organization, integration, accuracy, creativity, completeness), including interdisciplinary terminology integration and contextual appropriateness assessment.
Participation in 5 or more formative assessment activities combining peer and self-evaluation (including written feedback and oral presentation assessments)
Analysis of 10 or more language communication cases applicable to real workplace situations (comparing profession-specific vocabulary and formal/informal expressions)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
